0.headline: A rather uneventful period.
0.description: Nothing significant is happening in this calm period. Rest easy and prepare for tougher times ahead.

1.headline: Violent Fires
1.description: After a very dry summer, a rampant fire has broken out in one of every player's city (except for capitals) in that region. Downgrade at least one of your cities to a settlement in that region.

2.headline: A deadly Plague
2.description: A new plague has broken out in thi region. 33% of your armies vanish. (Divide by 3 and Round down. 8 Armies = 8/3 = 2 armies vanish)

3.headline: Poor Harvest
3.description: After a very turbulent summer, crops have grown poorly in this region. Territories in that region only yield half of the resources. Every city only yields 1 resource. Only half of your settlements yield resources (the players choose which of their settlements yield. Rounddown if the number is uneven. If you have 3 settlements (3/2) => 1 settlement yields resources). Occupied territories do not yield resources.

4.headline: Rebellion
4.description: Inhabitants are resisting your occupation and formed a rebellion to gain independence. Every occupied (=unsettled) territory in the region loses one army (if only one army was present in the territory, you lose the territory)

5.headline: Rich Harvests
5.description: Every player earns one additional resource from a rich harvest from a settled region of their choice.

6.headline: Call to arms
6.description: With increased tensions in the world, every player in the region earns an additional army to place anywhere within their territories

1.headline: Your Trade Network flurishes
1.description: Your trade network is blossoming. You can trade in goods with the bank for 1 less resource (3 of the same kind instead of 4).

2.headline: New Harvest machines
2.description: Through better technology you increase your crop yield this round. Cities produce 3 resources instead of 2.

1.headline: Urban Sprawl
1.description: People are flocking to the cities for better lives. Upgrade one of your settlements to a city for one less resource of your choosing.

2.headline: Better Sanitation
2.description: Better sanitation allows your cities to bloom. You receive an extra army in each city.

1.headline: For the Fatherland
1.description: Your people want to support their home. You get <ONE> extra army and station it anywhere

2.headline: Armed Industry Boom
2.description: Better production techniques make it cheaper to produce armies. Buy armies at one less resource of your choice.
